text.section:
On request, a correctional officer may have expunged from any file the record of a formal complaint made against the correctional officer if:
the Internal Investigative Unit that investigated the complaint:
exonerated the correctional officer of all charges in the complaint; or
determined that the charges were unsustained or unfounded; or
a hearing board acquitted the correctional officer, dismissed the action, or made a finding of not guilty.
There is no time requirement for expungement under paragraph (1) of this subsection.
